   Donald Trump
   stated on April 27, 2011 in a CNN interview:
   "We don't have bridges being built" in the United States.

true half-true
     * National
     * Infrastructure
     * Donald Trump
   By Robert Farley May 3, 2011

Trump: U.S. doesn't build bridges anymore

   Now that President Barack Obama has released his original Certificate of
   Birth, Donald Trump wants to talk about other things.
We don't have bridges being built.

In its "2010 Bridge Inventory" report, Better Roads Magazine analyzed the
   state of the nation's more than 600,000 bridges and concluded that a
   "worryingly high" number of them are structurally deficient or
   functionally obsolete.
